description: [Vanguard] "Against excellence in another [person], there is no way of defending ourselves except love." Johann Goethe, VBQ, p 51.
title: Africa: Mudi Africa At 30 - From Grass to Glory, By Dele Sobowale

description: [ISS] SADC member states must ensure that the operation in eastern DRC can overcome the challenges faced by its predecessors.
title: Africa: Can SAMIDRC Be Spared the Fate of Previous Peace Missions?

description: [Leadership] Commonwealth leaders have agreed that the time has come for a conversation about reparations for the slave trade, despite the UK's desire to keep the subject off the agenda at a two-day summit in Samoa.
title: Africa: Slave Trade - Commonwealth Heads Agree On Reparations Dialogue

description: [CAF] The Confédération Africaine de Football ("CAF") President Dr Patrice Motsepe is deeply saddened by the tragic news of a road accident in Zambia that claimed the lives of seven players from Chavuma Town Council Football Club.
title: Africa: CAF President Dr Motsepe Conveys Condolences to the Families of Late Chavuma FC Players and Zambian Football Family Following a Tragic Accident That Claimed Seven Lives

description: [Oxfam] The carbon footprint of a super-rich European, accumulated from nearly a week of using super yachts and private jets, matches the lifetime carbon footprint of someone in the world's poorest 1 percent, a new Oxfam report reveals today. The first-of-its-kind study, "Carbon Inequality Kills", tracks the emissions from private jets, yachts and polluting investments and comes ahead of COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan, amidst growing fears that climate breakdown is accelerating, driven largely by the emissions of the
title: Africa: Superyachts and Jets of Europe's Elite Emit More Carbon Pollution in a Week Than the World's Poorest 1 Percent Emits in a Lifetime

description: [SAnews.gov.za] The Presidency has reaffirmed South Africa's commitment to a foreign policy grounded in solidarity, peace, equality, human rights and sustainable development for the benefit of all.
title: Africa: Presidency Asserts Stance On South Africa's Foreign Policy

description: [SADC] The 9th Africa Regional Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction and the Eighth High-Level Meeting on Disaster Risk Reduction Meeting Was held in Windhoek, Namibia from 21 to 24 October 2024 and was organized by the African Union Commission and the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction in collaboration with the Southern African Development Community (SADC) under the theme under the theme "Act Now for the Resilient Africa We Want".
title: Africa: SADC and African Leaders Unite At 9th Africa Regional Platform to Strengthen Disaster Risk Reduction and Resilience

description: [The Earthshot Prize] Some of the world's most influential artists, athletes, musicians, and advocates will join The Earthshot Prize in Cape Town, South Africa this November to spotlight inspiring environmental solutions to repair and regenerate the planet.
title: Africa: Global Stars Unite for Earthshot Prize in South Africa

description: [IPS] Cali, Columbia -- At the end of the first week at the 16th Conference of Parties on Biodiversity (COP16), finance emerges as the biggest issue but also shrouded in controversies.
title: Africa: At COP16, Biodiversity Credits Raising Hopes and Protests

description: [HRW] Nairobi -- COMESA Should Work to Curb Atrocities, Protect Civilians, Promote Justice
title: Africa: Africa Summit - Address Rights Crises in DR Congo, Sudan

description: [Oxfam] Fifty of the world's richest billionaires on average produce more carbon through their investments, private jets and yachts in just over an hour and a half than the average person does in their entire lifetime, a new Oxfam report reveals today. The first-of-its-kind study, "Carbon Inequality Kills," tracks the emissions from private jets, yachts and polluting investments and details how the super-rich are fueling inequality, hunger and death across the world. The report comes ahead of COP29 in Baku,
title: Africa: Billionaires Emit More Carbon Pollution in 90 Minutes Than the Average Person Does in a Lifetime

description: [IPS] At the 2021 UN Climate Summit, Barbados prime minister Mia Mottley called for more and better use of special drawing rights (SDRs), the International Monetary Fund's reserve asset.
title: Africa: IMF Isn't Doing Enough to Support Africa - Billions Could Be Made Available Through Special Drawing Rights

description: [African Arguments] Korede Azeez is one of the Nigeria's most prolific breakout filmmakers. Her journey sheds light on the broader landscape of women in Nigeria's expanding film industry.
title: Africa: Sci-Fi, Folklore, and Faith - Korede Azeez's Unique Lens As a Nigerian Muslim Filmmaker

description: [IPS] Copenhagen &amp; Srinagar -- Anne Olhoff, Chief Climate Advisor at UNEP, underlined the urgent need for accelerated climate action ahead of COP29 in an exclusive interview with IPS. "The next six years are crucial--without accelerated action, we will miss the chance to limit warming to 1.5°C," she warned.
title: Africa: Without Accelerated Action, We Will Miss the Chance to Limit Warming to 1.5°c, Says UNEP Chief Climate Advisor

description: [VOA] Nairobi -- Bioeconomy is the production, use, and conservation of biological resources to produce goods that sustain communities. A new report says the promotion of bioeconomy as a way to deal with climate change holds promise for rural areas in Africa and elsewhere.
title: Africa: Bioeconomy Offers Path to Mitigating Climate Change, Enhancing Food Production

description: [The Conversation Africa] There are many myths about breast cancer, particularly in Africa with its rich diversity of people, different genetic backgrounds and ancestral histories.
title: Africa: Breast Cancer in Africa - Myths That Need to Be Debunked

description: [The Conversation Africa] The 29th Conference of the Parties (COP29) takes place in Azerbaijan in November 2024. The annual climate change conference must focus on holding corporations and countries accountable for greenhouse gas emissions.
title: Africa: Polluters Must Pay - How COP29 Can Make This a Reality
